abstract.p: Rev Susan H Schultz letter comments on Joan Murray's May 13 article about her encounter with elderly hitchhiker who apparently got lost on a walk

block.p: Joan Murray's Lives column (May 13) about the elderly hitchhiker hit home -- literally. I live in the same region and drive Route 20 frequently as a hospice chaplain. In that role, I visit many older people whose deepest desire is to live and die in their own homes.

Joan Murray's Lives column (May 13) about the elderly hitchhiker hit home -- literally. I live in the same region and drive Route 20 frequently as a hospice chaplain. In that role, I visit many older people whose deepest desire is to live and die in their own homes.

The story alluded to, but did not specifically credit, one thing that has allowed the woman to remain at home for so long: living in a small town where a neighbor will most likely find her and bring her safely home.
Murray did the compassionate and right thing. I hope if I ever find myself lost on Route 20, someone like her will come along.
